docs.lead_paragraph: Though the nation’s fiscal challenge has taken center stage in the presidential campaign, raising more taxes from American families remains stubbornly off the table.

headline.seo: Slipping Behind Because of an Aversion to Taxes — Economic Scene

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column on America's aversion to taxes; observes that even though the nation's fiscal challenge is a central issue in the presidential campaign, raising more taxes from American families remains stubbornly off the table; notes that most economists insist that raising taxes is the only way to maintain important benefits needed to keep up with the world.
docs.snippet: Though the nation’s fiscal challenge has taken center stage in the presidential campaign, raising more taxes from American families remains stubbornly off the table.

docs.lead_paragraph: Under private equity ownership, HCA made an aggressive push for more revenue that sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.

headline.seo: HCA, Giant Hospital Chain, Creates a Windfall for Private Equity
headline.main: A Giant Hospital Chain Is Blazing a Profit Trail
headline.print_headline: A Giant Hospital Chain Is Blazing a Profit Trail

docs.abstract: Profits at giant hospital chain HCA, which controls 163 facilities nationwide, have soared, far outpacing those of most of its competitors; under private equity ownership that includes Bain Capital, HCA has made an aggressive push for more revenue that has sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.
docs.snippet: Under private equity ownership, HCA made an aggressive push for more revenue that sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL and REED ABELSON

docs.lead_paragraph: During the Great Recession, when many hospitals across the country were nearly brought to their knees by growing numbers of uninsured patients, one hospital system not only survived -- it thrived.In fact, profits at the health care industry giant HCA , which controls 163 hospitals from New Hampshire to California, have soared , far outpacing those of most of its competitors.

headline.main: A Giant Hospital Chain Is Blazing a Profit Trail

docs.abstract: Profits at giant hospital chain HCA, which controls 163 facilities nationwide, have soared, far outpacing those of most of its competitors; under private equity ownership that includes Bain Capital, HCA has made an aggressive push for more revenue that has sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.
